headline: Investors Are Addicted to Risk. Berkshire Hathaway and Microsoft Stock Are the Antidotes.
summary: Investors have been piling into risky stocks, trying to keep up with the market’s torrid pace of gains.  Owning blue chips like  Berkshire Hathaway Microsoft  and  Walmart  is one way for investors to protect themselves against the inevitable blowback.  It’s been a bang-up year for the stock market with the  returning more than 16%.

headline: Walmart To Host Third Quarter Earnings Conference Call November 20, 2025
summary: BENTONVILLE, Ark., November 13, 2025--Walmart Inc. (NYSE: WMT) announced it will hold a live conference call with the investment community at 7 a.m. CST on Thursday, November 20, 2025, to discuss the company’s third quarter earnings results for fiscal year 2026. Doug McMillon, president and chief executive officer, and John David Rainey, executive vice president and chief financial officer, will host the call to discuss the results and answer questions.

headline: How Analyst Views on Walmart Are Shifting Amid New Growth Strategies and Industry Challenges
summary: Walmart stock has recently seen a slight upward revision in its fair value estimate, with analysts increasing the target from $113.60 to $113.78 per share. This shift reflects cautious optimism from the Street as experts weigh Walmart's operational strengths and strategic advancements alongside ongoing industry challenges. Stay tuned to discover how following updates to these analyst narratives can help you stay ahead of future changes in Walmart's valuation outlook. Stay updated as the Fair...

headline: N2Growth Announces Annual Leaders40 Top CHRO Award, Recognizing Excellence in Human Resources Leadership
summary: Philadelphia, Pennsylvania--(Newsfile Corp. - November 13, 2025) - N2Growth, a global leader in executive search and leadership advisory, today announced the 2025 Leaders40 Top Chief Human Resources Officers (CHRO) Award. This year's list includes leading CHROs at some of the world's largest and most influential companies, such as Lisa Buckingham (Vialto Partners), Matthew Breitfelder (Apollo Global Management), Robin Leopold (JPMorganChase), Christy Pambianchi (Caterpillar Inc.), Trisha Conley.
